cx.corp.lacuna.core.windows

Class WindowsMemoryReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • cx.corp.lacuna.core.windows.WindowsMemoryReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MemoryReader

    public class WindowsMemoryReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements MemoryReader
    Provides native process memory reading functionality on Windows platforms.

    • Constructor Summary

      WindowsMemoryReader(Kernel32 kernel)
      Instantiates a new WindowsMemoryReader instance using the specified Kernel32 WindowsAPI proxy.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public byte[] read(NativeProcess process,
                   int offset,
                   int bytesToRead)
            throws ProcessAccessException,
                   MemoryReadException
        Reads an array of bytes from the memory of the specified NativeProcess.

        This method may return a byte array with fewer elements than bytesToRead. The return value will always be a non-null byte array with a length between 0 and bytesToRead.

        This method implementation first attempts to open a handle for the specified process using the Windows API Kernel32.openProcess(int, boolean, int) method, then reads the specified memory segment using the Kernel32.readProcessMemory(int, int, Memory, int, IntByReference) method.

        In order to retrieve a NativeProcess instance, the NativeProcessEnumerator classes can be used. 

        
 NativeProcessEnumerator enumerator = new WindowsNativeProcessEnumerator(...);
 List<NativeProcess> processes = enumerator.getProcesses();
 MemoryReader reader = new WindowsMemoryReader(...);
 <p>
 try {
     byte[] bytes = reader.read(processes[0], 0x1C5B100, 16);
     for (byte b : bytes) {
         System.out.println("%X ", b);
     }
 } catch (ProcessAccessException | MemoryReadException ex) {
     System.err.println(ex.toString());
     if (ex.getCause() != null) {
         System.err.println("Cause: " + ex.getCause());
     }
 }
        Specified by:
        read in interface MemoryReader
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to read.
        offset - The memory address offset to read from.
        bytesToRead - The amount of bytes to read, starting from the offset.
        Returns:
        The read bytes.
        Throws:
        ProcessAccessException - if the specified process could not be opened for reading.
        MemoryReadException - if reading the process memory fails.
